children.subject: Try also looking for sublets. Summer rent often comes with steep discount if you sublet because most students go home for the summer so nobody is looking to stay for only May-Aug.
<md>What about live in Berkeley and Bart to SF everyday - many students are trying to sublet. Only bringing this up since you mentioned Oakland as a possibility.</md>
Will also be interning in SF for the summer, heard airbnb is the way to go. Definitely don't live in Oakland, sure it is cheaper but the commute + increase in crime rate isn't worth it IMO.

I think that’s solid, for me my lease ends since im in student housing. I would probably do what you plan to do if I was in your situation, but the commute is a bit longer, not too bad and you also kinda miss out on sf lifestyle but hey you keep the rent money!

Do most people not just stay in their current Berkeley apartment and then commute everyday? That's what I was thinking of doing, or is that impractical? Sounds pretty reasonable I think (if you lease doesn't end by then, of course)

history.content: Hi, I'm interning at Salesforce this summer and it's in person. I have been looking into housing with roommates and we are trying to find the best bang for our buck. We are looking into airbnbs and apartments in SF and Oakland. Are there any resources, suggestions, or apartments that I should look into? Should I try to find somewhere in SF or Oakland since Oakland is typically cheaper than sf for rent. Also, should I get an apartment or airbnb, like which is the better deal? Thanks in advance!
history.subject: SF Intern Housing
